    • Uses of LTL in org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.ltl

      Subclasses of LTL in org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.ltl 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  LTLAlways
      This class represents LTL formulae in "[] f" form.
      class  LTLAnd
      This class represents LTL formulae in "f ∧ g" form.
      class  LTLAtomic
      This class represents the atomic propositions in LTL.
      class  LTLBackto
      This class represents LTL formulae in "f B g" form.
      class  LTLBefore
      This class represents LTL formulae in "(~) f" form.
      class  LTLBinary
      This class represents LTL formulae formed by a binary operator, for example "f U g", "f R g", "f S g", "f B g", "f T g", "f --> g", or "f <--> g".
      class  LTLEquivalence
      This class represents LTL formulae in "(f <--> g)" form.
      class  LTLImplication
      This class represents LTL formulae in "(f --> g)" form.
      class  LTLNegation
      This class represents LTL formulae in "~ f" form.
      class  LTLNext
      This class represents LTL formulae in "() f" form.
      class  LTLOnce
      This class represents LTL formulae in "<-> f" form.
      class  LTLOr
      This class represents LTL formulae in "f1 ∨ f2 ∨ ...
      class  LTLPrevious
      This class represents LTL formulae in "(-) f" form.
      class  LTLRelease
      This class represents LTL formulae in "f R g" form.
      class  LTLSince
      This class represents LTL formulae in "f S g" form.
      class  LTLSofar
      This class represents LTL formula in "[-] f" form.
      class  LTLSometime
      This class represents LTL formulae in "<> f" form.
      class  LTLTrigger
      This class represents LTL formulae in "f T g" form.
      class  LTLUnary
      This class represents LTL formulae obtained by applying a unary operator to a LTL formula, for example, "~ f", "() f", "<> f", "[] f", "(-) f", "(~) f", "<-> f", and "[-] f".
      class  LTLUnless
      This class represents LTL formulae in "f W g" form.
      class  LTLUntil
      This class represents LTL formulae in "f U g" form.

      Simplifies the input formula, convert the formula into negation form, initialize the BDD manager, initialize the NTGBW, create the initial state, invoke Couvreur.expand(LTLSet) to expand the NTGBW, merge equivalent states, and reduce unreachable and dead states.

      FSA LTL2BuchiTranslators.LTL2NTGBW.translate(LTL formula) 
      FSA LTL2BuchiTranslators.LTL2NBW.translate(LTL formula) 
      FSA LTL2Buchi.translate(LTL formula)
      This method first simplifies the input formula (if the option is enabled), converts the formula to negation normal form, initializes the NTGBW, initializes the acceptance condition with acceptance sets put in LTL2Buchi.acc_map, and finally invoke LTL2Buchi.expand(LTL) to construct the NTGBW.
      FSA ExtendedLTL2BuchiTranslators.LTL2NTGBW.translate(LTL formula) 
      FSA ExtendedLTL2BuchiTranslators.LTL2NBW.translate(LTL formula) 
      FSA ExtendedLTL2Buchi.translate(LTL formula)

      Computes the promising formulae fulfilled by a node with respect to a specified formula.
      protected void LTL2Buchi.updatePromisedObligations(LTL f, Node node)
      Inserts a specified formula to a specified node as a formula promised to be satisfied by the node.
